IR Validation: Arbitrage-Free Diagnostics (Finding 1)

Core metrics

xva_engine.validation.ir.arbitrage_free.metrics.pillars_years(pillars_days, day_count=365.0)[source]
Return type:

ndarray

xva_engine.validation.ir.arbitrage_free.metrics.discount_factors_from_zero_rates(rates, pillars_days, day_count=365.0)[source]

rates: (P,T,K) continuous zero rates DF(t,t+M_k)=exp(-rate*M_k_years)

Return type:

ndarray

xva_engine.validation.ir.arbitrage_free.metrics.df_monotonicity_violations(df, tol=0.0)[source]
Return type:

dict

xva_engine.validation.ir.arbitrage_free.metrics.implied_forward(r_i, r_j, M_i, M_j)[source]
Return type:

ndarray

xva_engine.validation.ir.arbitrage_free.metrics.kink_index(rates)[source]

max abs second diff along pillars, returns (P,T)

Return type:

ndarray

xva_engine.validation.ir.arbitrage_free.metrics.interp_rate_at_maturity(rates_t, M, target)[source]

rates_t: (P,K) rates across pillars at fixed time returns: (P,) interpolated rate at maturity target (years)

Return type:

ndarray

xva_engine.validation.ir.arbitrage_free.metrics.df_wedge_one_step(rates, time_grid_years, pillars_days, base_pillar_index, step_index, day_count=365.0)[source]

wedge = log DF(t,T) - log DF(t,u) - log DF(t+u,T-u) using interpolated rates at maturities u and T-u.

Return type:

dict
